item.title: Bins overflowing and park litter, 16th July
item.description:
Bins now Malin Road are overflowing and there is lots of litter around the edge of the park, Discarded parcels and clothes that some people have obviously stolen (there were teenagers in the park riding electric scooters and mopeds a few evenings ago)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maberley Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: All parking restriction signs along length of road have been removed in last month, 16th July
item.description:
As well as the weekly fly tipping, most recently piles of asbestos left for weeks, in the past month as local residents we have noticed that all the parking restriction signs have been removed from the lamp posts. This coincides with our street becoming full of parked cars, in particular vans who we believe the residents from the new developments built in the area. Residents have received no notification that parking restrictions were being removed. Is this vandalism or have the council decided to make our street a car park as well as a rubbish dump for the local fly tippers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Mandela Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
